intro: Anthospermum viscosum, commonly known as sticky ant plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and sticky secretions on its stems and leaves. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in various conditions.
